PAGE.TITLE: Variable separable differential equations
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
A differential equation is said to be separable if the variables can be separated. That is, a
separable equation is one that can be written in the form:
$$
\textrm{d}f = g(x) \textrm{d}x
$$
The general solution to these types of differential equations is:
$$
f(x) = \exp\left( -\int_0^x g(x') \textrm{d}x' \right)
$$

UL.LI: You should be able to recognize when a differential equation can be solved by separation of variables.
You should be able to use the method of separation of variables to solve differential equations.
